issue.title: test: `minisketch_tests.cpp` can fail when built with MSVC
issue.body:
To trigger the [failure](https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4513724340895744), consider the [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commit/c218353ca987e6f6888cccaf8b547d1aed68c333) as follows:
```diff
--- a/src/test/minisketch_tests.cpp
+++ b/src/test/minisketch_tests.cpp
@@ -27,6 +27,11 @@ BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE(minisketch_test)
         uint32_t start_b = start_a + a_not_b;
         uint32_t end_b = start_b + both + b_not_a;
 
+#ifdef _MSC_VER
+        // FIXME
+        BOOST_TEST_MESSAGE("This message *breaks* this test when running with '-l test_suite'");
+#endif
+
         Minisketch sketch_a = MakeMinisketch32(10);
         for (uint32_t a = start_a; a < end_a; ++a) sketch_a.Add(a);
         Minisketch sketch_b = MakeMinisketch32(10);
```

The observing behavior:
```
>build_msvc\x64\Release\test_bitcoin.exe -t minisketch_tests
Running 1 test case...
unknown location(0): fatal error: in "minisketch_tests/minisketch_test": memory access violation occurred at address 0xffffffff, while attempting to  read inaccessible data
C:\Users\hebasto\bitcoin\src\test\minisketch_tests.cpp(18): last checkpoint: "minisketch_test" test entry

*** 1 failure is detected in the test module "Bitcoin Core Test Suite"

```

Assuming either MSVC bug or non-portable code?

events.body:
cc @sipsorcery @sipa 

Hoping on your insights as this issue is the current problem in #25797.

`BOOST_TEST_MESSAGE` isn't thread safe, but this shouldn't be the issue. Does it also happen in valgrind/sanitizers?

Unrelated: The BOOST_CHECK needs to be replaced by BOOST_REQUIRE or Assert to avoid UB in case of failure.

issue.title: test: Prevent UB in `minisketch_tests.cpp`
issue.body:
[`std::optional::operator*`](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/optional/operator*), which follows after the changed line, can cause UB.

This PR addresses https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/26262#issuecomment-1268855418

issue.title: Errors when building with MSVC
issue.body:
There is a [`minisketch_tests.cpp`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/test/minisketch_tests.cpp) test in the Bitcoin Core project. Being built with MSVC, it fails in different scenarios:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/24664
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/26262

A similar issue has been observed when using experimental [CMake-based build system](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25797) as well.

Another simple way to reproduce the issue is to build `libminisketch` [without clmul instructions support](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commit/79068de782c8bf31bb9bbf0836e1f7e75ed55ec5), see this [branch](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/221006-msvc.bug.DEMO):
```
C:\Users\hebasto\bitcoin>build_msvc\x64\Release\test_bitcoin.exe -t minisketch_tests
Running 1 test case...
C:/Users/hebasto/bitcoin/src/test/minisketch_tests.cpp(43): fatal error: in "minisketch_tests/minisketch_test": critical check dec.has_value() has failed

*** 1 failure is detected in the test module "Bitcoin Core Test Suite"

C:\Users\hebasto\bitcoin>msbuild --version
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 17.2.1+52cd2da31 for .NET Framework
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

17.2.1.25201
```

UPDATE: also see https://github.com/sipa/minisketch/issues/67#issuecomment-1272385185

issue.title: Update minisketch subtree to latest upstream
issue.body:
Contains:
- https://github.com/sipa/minisketch/pull/68
- https://github.com/sipa/minisketch/pull/69
- https://github.com/sipa/minisketch/pull/70
- https://github.com/sipa/minisketch/pull/72

Fixes bitcoin/bitcoin#26262.

Required for bitcoin/bitcoin#25797.
